intro: Telipogon parvulus, commonly known as the small-flowered sandwort, is a small perennial herb native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. The plant has slender stems with small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale pink. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Telipogon parvulus is an important component of alpine and tundra ecosystems.
